page.title: 07AWLISCOMBE IN 1985
page.content: AWLISCOMBE IS A PARISH AND A VILLAGE SITUATED ON THE MAIN (A373) ROAD FROM HONITON TO CULLOMPTON,2 MILES N.W. HONITON, 16 MILES N.E.EXETER. THE MAIN TYPE OF OCCUPATION IS FARMING. MOST OF THE LAND IS USED FOR DAIRY FARMING,BUT OTHER OCCUPATIONS AND BUSINESSES FLOURISH TOO. THERE IS A WELL ESTABLISHED BUILDERS MERCHANT ON THE PERIPHERY OF THE VILLAGE. THE VILLAGE PUB CONTINUES TO ATTRACT MANY PEOPLE FROM FAR AND WIDE. IT HAS ITS OWN RESTAURANT TOO. THE SCHOOL IN THE VILLAGE CURRENTLY HAS 84 PRIMARY AGED CHILDREN. IT IS ABLE TO BOAST A VERY LARGE CATCHMENT AREA. THE THRIVING CHURCH OF ST. MICHAEL & ALL ANGELS STANDS SET BACK FROM THE MAIN ROAD ON A SMALL HILL. A MILE N. OF THE VILLAGE IS AN OLD PEOPLE'S HOME. THE VILLAGE HAS A GOOD BALANCE BETWEEN AGE GROUPS, AND IS A THRIVING COMMUNITY.
